pullrequest.title: PresetManager Part 2: command line, SDF generation, unit test

content.raw:
I'm conflicted about adding a warning here, it may lead to spurious messages.

This check is here because there are some elements that have multiple blocks for each physics engine (see [`test/worlds/presets.world`](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/d7da929b192d3e7e1ddcd3cd49c2f67d07de8d9d/test/worlds/presets.world?at=default)). This check ignores a block that is named for a different physics engine than the one that was assigned at runtime. In the example I linked, `ode` is the default physics type, so this line skips over the blocks `simbody` and `bullet` so that the physics engine doesn't try to add a lot of parameters that will give warnings. Therefore, if I add a warning here, it will be displayed 3 times whenever this world gets loaded.
content.html:
I'm conflicted about adding a warning here, it may lead to spurious messages.

This check is here because there are some elements that have multiple blocks for each physics engine (see test/worlds/presets.world). This check ignores a block that is named for a different physics engine than the one that was assigned at runtime. In the example I linked, ode is the default physics type, so this line skips over the blocks simbody and bullet so that the physics engine doesn't try to add a lot of parameters that will give warnings. Therefore, if I add a warning here, it will be displayed 3 times whenever this world gets loaded.
